data.title: La Grange Ranked Among Best Illinois Cities for Families
data.meta_description: La Grange Ranked Among Best Illinois Cities for Families - La Grange, IL - WalletHub has released its 2016 list of best and worst cities in Illinois for families.
data.text:
WalletHub has released its 2016 list of best and worst cities in Illinois for families.

La Grange is a great place to live for plenty of reasons, and now you can keep your humble bragging current with the latest ranking of best and worst Illinois cities for families from WalletHub.

La Grange comes in as the No. 21 overall best city for families in the state.

Of the 162 cities included in the study, La Grange ranked No. 20 for family life and fun. It earned 35th place for affordability, 51st place for education, health and safety and 44th place for socioeconomic environment.

Click the map for more information.

Several other towns throughout the Chicago suburbs were highly ranked for family raising, the study reports.

Top Chicago suburbs on the list include Deerfield (No. 2), Libertyville (No. 4), Hinsdale (No. 6), Cary (No. 7), Lake in the Hills (No. 8), Frankfort (No. 9) and Naperville (No 10).

But several of the top 10 worst towns in Illinois are also located in the Chicago suburbs.

Among the worst suburbs for families on WalletHub’s list were Harvey, Dolton, Maywood and Blue Island.

WalletHub ranked Morton, a village of about 15,000 residents located southeast of Peoria, as the best town in Illinois for families. East St. Louis, located on the Mississippi River just east of St. Louis, was named the worst town in Illinois for families.

To create the ranking, WalletHub’s analysts compared 162 cities in the state using 21 indicators of “ideal family conditions.” Some of those conditions included percentage of families with young children, median family income, housing affordability, quality of the school systems, number of parks and attractions and a separation and divorce rates. The full methodology can be found here.

Below is a list of the 40 best and worst cities from the study.

Amie Schaenzer contributed to this article.
